reasoning: Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (Osler-Weber-Rendu syndrome) is a lifelong genetic disorder; prevalence is more appropriate than incidence. Estimated prevalence ~1 per 5,000-8,000 individuals (150 per 100k). Inheritance is autosomal dominant. Limited epidemiological studies but consistent across multiple sources.
source: Multiple genetic disorder registries and epidemiological studies
